summary: This bill, the Choice Neighborhoods Initiative Act of 2025, authorizes the Department of Housing and Urban Development to award competitive grants to revitalize severely distressed housing and transform neighborhoods of extreme poverty into mixed-income communities. The bill outlines eligible entities, eligible neighborhoods, authorized activities (including housing transformation, economic self-sufficiency programs, and supportive services), and requirements for transformation plans. Key provisions address resident rights to return, relocation assistance, and one-for-one replacement of demolished housing units. Funding is authorized for grants and rental assistance.
